title: Domain 1.2: Compare and contrast the display components of mobile devices
content:
🔐 PHYSICAL PRIVACY & SECURITY COMPONENTS

🧲 Hard Drive Locks / Physical Security

Some business laptops support drive lock passwords in BIOS.

Physical brackets or locking mechanisms can deter theft.

🧠 EXAM TIP: Be ready to identify a BIOS password screen and explain how it protects drive data.

🪟 Privacy Filters

Screens that reduce viewing angles → only someone directly in front can see the screen.

Helpful in public settings like airports.

🧠 EXAM TIP: You may get a question where a user complains about 'screen being dark from the side'—correct answer: privacy filter.

🧷 Kensington Locks

Small lock slot on laptops that anchors them to a desk.

Prevents physical theft.

🧠 EXAM TIP: If a question involves 'preventing someone from walking off with the laptop,' the answer is probably 'Kensington lock.'

🎓 FINAL TIPS FOR THE EXAM

  • ✅ Know which parts are user-replaceable (RAM, storage, battery, keyboard).
  • ✅ Be able to identify connectors and ports on diagrams (especially ZIF, M.2, SODIMM).
  • ✅ Understand privacy and security features — from biometrics to NFC to Kensington locks.
  • ✅ Practice spotting the difference between upgrade vs. migration.
  • ✅ Brush up on common tools: antistatic wrist strap, plastic spudger, screwdriver.
